1 esdras.gloss: an Apocryphal book consisting of a compilation from I Chronicles and II Chronicles and Ezra and Nehemiah

2 esdras.gloss: an Apocryphal book of angelic revelations

e.s.p..gloss: apparent power to perceive things that are not present to the senses

es.gloss: a radioactive transuranic element produced by bombarding plutonium with neutrons

esaki.gloss: physicist honored for advances in solid state electronics (born in Japan in 1925)

escalator.gloss: a clause in a contract that provides for an increase or a decrease in wages or prices or benefits etc. depending on certain conditions (as a change in the cost of living index)
a stairway whose steps move continuously on a circulating belt

escalator clause.gloss: a clause in a contract that provides for an increase or a decrease in wages or prices or benefits etc. depending on certain conditions (as a change in the cost of living index)

escallop.gloss: bake in a sauce, milk, etc., often with breadcrumbs on top

escapade.gloss: a wild and exciting undertaking (not necessarily lawful)

escape cock.gloss: a valve in a container in which pressure can build up (as a steam boiler)

escape expert.gloss: an entertainer who is expert in the art of escaping

escape valve.gloss: a valve in a container in which pressure can build up (as a steam boiler)

escapism.gloss: an inclination to retreat from unpleasant realities through diversion or fantasy

escapist.gloss: a person who escapes into a world of fantasy

escapologist.gloss: an entertainer who is expert in the art of escaping

escargot.gloss: edible terrestrial snail usually served in the shell with a sauce of melted butter and garlic

escarole.gloss: variety of endive having leaves with irregular frilled edges

escarp.gloss: a steep artificial slope in front of a fortification

escarpment.gloss: a long steep slope or cliff at the edge of a plateau or ridge
a steep artificial slope in front of a fortification

eschalot.gloss: type of onion plant producing small clustered mild-flavored bulbs used as seasoning

eschaton.gloss: (New Testament) day at the end of time following Armageddon when God will decree the fates of all individual humans according to the good and evil of their earthly lives

escherichia coli.gloss: a species of bacterium normally present in intestinal tract of humans and other animals

eschrichtius.gloss: type and sole genus of the Eschrichtiidae

eschrichtius gibbosus.gloss: medium-sized greyish-black whale of the northern Pacific

eschrichtius robustus.gloss: medium-sized greyish-black whale of the northern Pacific

eschscholtzia.gloss: showy herbs of western North America

eschscholtzia californica.gloss: of Pacific coast of North America

escolar.gloss: large snake mackerel with rings like spectacles around its eyes

escudo.gloss: formerly the basic monetary unit of Portugal
the basic unit of money on Cape Verde

escutcheon.gloss: a flat protective covering (on a door or wall etc) to prevent soiling by dirty fingers

ese.gloss: the compass point midway between east and southeast

esidrix.gloss: a diuretic drug (trade name Microzide, Esidrix, and HydroDIURIL) used in the treatment of hypertension

eskalith.gloss: a white powder (LiCO3) used in manufacturing glass and ceramics and as a drug

eskimo.gloss: a member of a people inhabiting the Arctic (northern Canada or Greenland or Alaska or eastern Siberia)

eskimo-aleut.gloss: the family of languages that includes Eskimo and Aleut

eskimo-aleut language.gloss: the family of languages that includes Eskimo and Aleut

eskimo curlew.gloss: New World curlew that breeds in northern North America

eskimo dog.gloss: breed of heavy-coated Arctic sled dog

esm.gloss: electronic warfare undertaken under direct control of an operational commander to locate sources of radiated electromagnetic energy for the purpose of immediate threat recognition

esme stuart lennox robinson.gloss: Irish playwright and theater manager in Dublin (1886-1958)

esmolol.gloss: intravenous beta blocker (trade name Brevibloc) that acts for only a short time

esop.gloss: a program under which employees regularly accumulate shares and may ultimately assume control of the company

esophageal reflux.gloss: reflux of stomach contents into the esophagus

esophageal veins.gloss: small veins from the esophagus emptying into the brachiocephalic vein or the azygos veins

esophagogastric junction.gloss: the junction between the esophagus and the stomach epithelium

esophagoscope.gloss: an optical instrument for examining the inside of the esophagus

esophagus.gloss: the passage between the pharynx and the stomach

esotropia.gloss: strabismus in which one or both eyes turn inward toward the nose

esox.gloss: type and only genus of the family Esocidae

esox americanus.gloss: small but gamy pickerel of Atlantic coastal states

esox lucius.gloss: voracious piscivorous pike of waters of northern hemisphere

esox masquinongy.gloss: large (60 to 80 pounds) sport fish of North America

esox niger.gloss: common in quiet waters of eastern United States

esp.gloss: apparent power to perceive things that are not present to the senses

espagnole.gloss: brown sauce with tomatoes and a caramelized mixture of minced carrots and onions and celery seasoned with Madeira

espana.gloss: a parliamentary monarchy in southwestern Europe on the Iberian Peninsula

esparcet.gloss: Eurasian perennial herb having pale pink flowers and curved pods

espousal.gloss: archaic terms for a wedding or wedding feast
the act of becoming betrothed or engaged
the act of accepting with approval

esprit de corps.gloss: the spirit of a group that makes the members want the group to succeed

esq.gloss: a title of respect for a member of the English gentry ranking just below a knight

esquimau.gloss: a member of a people inhabiting the Arctic (northern Canada or Greenland or Alaska or eastern Siberia)

esquire.gloss: a title of respect for a member of the English gentry ranking just below a knight

esr.gloss: the rate at which red blood cells settle out in a tube of blood under standardized conditions
microwave spectroscopy in which there is resonant absorption of radiation by a paramagnet

essence.gloss: the choicest or most essential or most vital part of some idea or experience
the central meaning or theme of a speech or literary work
a toiletry that emits and diffuses a fragrant odor

essential.gloss: defining rights and duties as opposed to giving the rules by which rights and duties are established

essential hypertension.gloss: persistent and pathological high blood pressure for which no specific cause can be found

essential oil.gloss: an oil having the odor or flavor of the plant from which it comes

essonite.gloss: a garnet ranging in color from yellow to brown

est.gloss: standard time in the 5th time zone west of Greenwich, reckoned at the 75th meridian

establishment.gloss: the act of forming or establishing something
an organization founded and united for a specific purpose
the persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a body for the purpose of administering something
(ecology) the process by which a plant or animal becomes established in a new habitat
the cognitive process of establishing a valid proof

establishmentarianism.gloss: the doctrine of supporting the social or political establishment

establishmentism.gloss: the doctrine of supporting the social or political establishment

estate.gloss: extensive landed property (especially in the country) retained by the owner for his own use
a major social class or order of persons regarded collectively as part of the body politic of the country (especially in the United Kingdom) and formerly possessing distinct political rights

estate agent.gloss: a person who is authorized to act as an agent for the sale of land

estate car.gloss: a car that has a long body and rear door with space behind rear seat

estate for life.gloss: (law) an estate whose duration is limited to the life of the person holding it

estate of the realm.gloss: a major social class or order of persons regarded collectively as part of the body politic of the country (especially in the United Kingdom) and formerly possessing distinct political rights

estate tax.gloss: a tax on the estate of the deceased person

estazolam.gloss: a frequently prescribed sleeping pill (trade name ProSom)

esther.gloss: an Old Testament book telling of a beautiful Jewess who became queen of Persia and saved her people from massacre

esthesis.gloss: an unelaborated elementary awareness of stimulation

esthete.gloss: one who professes great sensitivity to the beauty of art and nature

esthetic.gloss: concerning or characterized by an appreciation of beauty or good taste

esthetician.gloss: a worker skilled in giving beauty treatments (manicures and facials etc.)

esthetics.gloss: (art) the branch of philosophy dealing with beauty and taste (emphasizing the evaluative criteria that are applied to art)

esthonia.gloss: a republic in northeastern Europe on the Baltic Sea

estimate.gloss: judge tentatively or form an estimate of (quantities or time)

estimated tax return.gloss: return required of a taxpayer whose tax withheld from income does not meet the tax liability for the year

estimation.gloss: a document appraising the value of something (as for insurance or taxation)
an approximate calculation of quantity or degree or worth

estimator.gloss: an expert at calculation (or at operating calculating machines)

estivation.gloss: (zoology) cessation or slowing of activity during the summer

estonia.gloss: a republic in northeastern Europe on the Baltic Sea

estradiol.gloss: the most powerful female hormone that occurs naturally

estrangement.gloss: the feeling of being alienated from other people

estraterrestrial body.gloss: a natural object existing outside the earth and outside the earth's atmosphere

estrogen.gloss: a general term for female steroid sex hormones that are secreted by the ovary and responsible for typical female sexual characteristics

estrogen antagonist.gloss: an antagonist for estrogen that is used in the treatment of breast cancer

estrone.gloss: a naturally occurring weak estrogenic hormone secreted by the mammalian ovary

estronol.gloss: a naturally occurring weak estrogenic hormone secreted by the mammalian ovary

estrus.gloss: applies to nonhuman mammals: a state or period of heightened sexual arousal and activity

eschew.gloss: avoid and stay away from deliberately

espouse.gloss: take up the cause, ideology, practice, method, of someone and use it as one's own

essay.gloss: put to the test, as for its quality, or give experimental use to

establish.gloss: set up or lay the groundwork for
establish the validity of something, as by an example, explanation or experiment

estrange.gloss: arouse hostility or indifference in where there had formerly been love, affection, or friendliness

especial.gloss: surpassing what is common or usual or expected

established.gloss: brought about or set up or accepted
introduced from another region and persisting without cultivation

esthetical.gloss: concerning or characterized by an appreciation of beauty or good taste

estuarial.gloss: of or relating to or found in estuaries

estuarine.gloss: of or relating to or found in estuaries

esurient.gloss: (often followed by `for') ardently or excessively desirous
devouring or craving food in great quantities

especially.gloss: to a distinctly greater extent or degree than is common
